simplesect.title: NAME
simplesect.simpara: git-write-tree - Create a tree object from the current index

simplesect.title: DESCRIPTION
simplesect.simpara: Creates a tree object using the current index. The name of the new tree object is printed to standard output.
The index must be in a fully merged state.

Conceptually, git write-tree sync()s the current index contents into a set of tree files. In order to have that match what is actually in your directory right now, you need to have done a git update-index phase before you did the git write-tree.

listitem.simpara: Normally git write-tree ensures that the objects referenced by the directory exist in the object database. This option disables this check.
Writes a tree object that represents a subdirectory <prefix>. This can be used to write the tree object for a subproject that is in the named subdirectory.
